Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Embolic Protection Devices in Surgical Aortic Valve Replacement

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 383 patients undergoing SAVR

Participants.evidence: 383 patients undergoing SAVR, with 41% receiving concomitant coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG)

Intervention.evidence: to assess the efficacy of embolic protection devices

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was 90-day functional status, neurocognitive decline from pre-surgical baseline, and quality of life (QoL).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Stroke was associated with longer hospital stays (HR 0.62; 95% CI 0.42–0.94; p=0.02) and poorer outcomes at 90 days, including higher modified Rankin scores (OR 5.9; 95% CI 1.7–20.1; p=0.01), depression (OR 5.3; 95% CI 1.6–17.3; p=0.006), and neurocognitive decline (OR 7.8; 95% CI 2.3–26.4; p=0.001).

Harms.evidence: By day 7, 25 (6.6%) patients experienced stroke, and 103 (28.5%) had delirium.
